description: From French Gargantua, a giant with a very large appetite in Rabelais's The Inestimable Life of Gargantua. Rabelais derived Gargantua from the Portuguese and Spanish garganta (“throat”).

adjectives.description: gargantuan (comparative more gargantuan, superlative most gargantuan)

examples: Synonyms: colossal, enormous, giant, huge, humongous, immense; see also Thesaurus:large

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Of the giant Gargantua or his appetite.
